profile.headline: Multimodal Language Models · Multimedia Retrieval · Music-Language Modeling
profile.affiliation: Ph.D. student, National University of Singapore
about: Hi! I’m Teng Tu (涂腾), a Ph.D. student at the National University of Singapore. My research spans multimodal language models and multimedia information retrieval, with ongoing work on music-language modeling that unifies symbolic and waveform representations.
Outside of research, I enjoy travel photography, building small creative demos, and writing.

peer_reviewed.title: Integrating Symbolic and Waveform Music into Large Language Models
peer_reviewed.authors: Teng Tu, Xiaohao Liu, Yunshan Ma, Ji Qi, Tat-Seng Chua

B.Sc. in Computer Science and Technology

experience.title: Researcher, NExT++ Research Center (NUS)
highlights: Multimodal language models and multimedia retrieval.
Music-language modeling bridging symbolic and waveform representations.

experience.title: Research Intern, Knowledge Engineering Group (Tsinghua University)
highlights: NLP, multimodal information processing, and knowledge graphs.
Contributed to GOAL (CIKM 2023), CogKR (TKDE 2021), and ContextCam (CHI 2024).

experience.title: Multimodal Intern, Zhipu AI
highlights: Improved a visual tokenizer for adaptive aspect ratios across products.

experience.title: AI Intern, Kuaishou
highlights: Built a knowledge-based video Q&A system leveraging multimodal knowledge graphs.

experience.title: NLP Intern, Fourth Paradigm
highlights: Explored knowledge extraction and graph link prediction; proposed product improvements.
